references.paper_title: Bayesian inference of individualized treatment effects using multi-task Gaussian processes
references.reason: This paper is foundational for Bayesian approaches to individualized treatment effects, a key topic in the paper's methodology.

references.paper_title: Bayesian nonparametric causal inference: Information rates and learning algorithms
references.reason: This work is highly relevant to the theoretical underpinnings of causal inference methods used in the paper.

references.paper_title: Nonparametric estimation of heterogeneous treatment effects: From theory to learning algorithms
references.reason: This paper provides important context on nonparametric methods for heterogeneous treatment effects, a significant aspect of the proposed method.
This is the foundational work for diffusion models, the core of the proposed methodology.

references.paper_title: Towards optimal doubly robust estimation of heterogeneous causal effects
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the theoretical foundations of the doubly robust estimation, which is used in the proposed method.
